channel.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
channel.description:
Ok, I'm going to ask for a civilized discussion on this topic.
This question has been asked numerous times, with the response of 'When they make a good one, we will think about it.' Many of you now know what I am talking about: subsection(s) for different protocols. I don't mean you need to make a new board for each, but at least a sub-board of server downloads called '508+ Server Downloads' or something.
The staff response is hardly an adequate retort to this question, because people obviously don't care if there is a good one made yet, they still download it, and 508+ is getting steadily more and more popular. Unless people are going to start putting [508] or [317] on each of their topic titles, it is rather annoying having to look through each thread to even find the protocol you want to download.
If someone wants to easily find a 508, they honestly don't care if the staff thinks 'there are no good 508 servers', they just want to download one. Why can't there be a subsection for the higher protocols? I would love to hear the real reason from a staff member (if there is one?) and hear everyone else's thoughts on the matter.

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:86, topic:345799”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=442183.msg3313436#msg3313436 date=1282147486]

The Server Download section is getting so much traffic, creating a child board wont effect anything…

See what i mean. And that was taken this morning when barely anyone is online…
[/quote]What do you mean it wont effect anything? That makes no sense at all. Just because there are a lot of people on that section doesn’t mean that creating a sub section will do nothing. If anything, it just proves that more organization is needed.

  • 300s-399
  • 399-499
  • 500+
    Nuff said, Also this will organise things and help people who can read the board names[/quote]Or just one for 508+ and one for all of the others…

Read full topic

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:81, topic:345799”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=442183.msg3308738#msg3308738 date=1281834179]

New subsections would just create a bigger workload for the staff; there’ll be more misplaced topics and the staff will have to move/clear them.
[/quote]If people have to specifically click on the proper revision, they wont put it in the wrong section. The main reason there are wrong topics now is because people don’t know if it should be server or client help, or if it’s a tutorial or not etc.

90% of the people on mscp are < 12…literally. Loads of people post in the wrong section every day, and what’s to stop them from posting in the wrong section with newer subsections?[/quote]I’m not saying that this will stop them from posting in the wrong section, I’m saying that it will not make it worse.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:76, topic:345799”]as I recall something similar was tried in the past. The splitting of the sections caused moderators to neglect some areas and it turned out to be a big mess. no one wants to do extensive navigations just to post a topic.[/quote]I totally understand what you mean, like on other sites they go 4-5 deep until you can find the proper board. But here it would just be R2SE -> Downloads (or Help) - > Your cache revision; On the main site that’s no deeper than it would be to go to General Questions.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

I think this would be a good idea, However, going back to the Search function.

we all have to admit the Search Function on SMF Forums isn’t exactly the best thing in the world. But if you’ve looked at a vBulletin forum recently you will notice that the search function in that is actually pretty top notch (in my opinion) so really, wouldn’t it be a good idea if MITB and some of the PHP programmers got together and integrated the vB search into smf? Just a suggestion lol.

( i know i’ll probs get flammed for this )

Read full topic

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:73, topic:345799”]Really it all comes down to what are the advantages and disadvantages.
Need I state the advantages? And the disadvantages… well, there are none, really.

Besides what Lin stated about activeness, but if you go over to Mitb, check how active the boards are there, and that’s still a fully working forum community.[/quote]Has the staff ever put it to vote? If you do, have a link to this thread or something so they can hear what people like/dislike.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:69, topic:345799”]This argument is NOT about what type of server you think is ‘better’ or which you would rather play. There was only one legitimate ‘no’ post that I read since my last post, so I will reply to it.

[quote author=Lin link=topic=442183.msg3301751#msg3301751 date=1281359448]
Not really. Most of the sections aren’t very active, and 508 boards will just make the forum seem kind of dead. The only active section that could really use it is the Downloads section, but it’s pretty easy to get around, especially with the search bar. My vote goes to no.
[/quote] The two sections I want are the Downloads and the Help sections. In the help section, there are over 6 pages per 24 hours posted; I think splitting that into probably 5 and 2 (more people need 317 than 508 help) is totally reasonable.[/quote]
I agree with Davidi2. The server help is filled with retarded topics that don’t specify which revision they need help on.

Read full topic

item.title: New Subsections [Discussion]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:70, topic:345799”]Why? None of the boards are protocol specific anyways, I don’t see why we should go through the trouble in making them that way, especially since new protocols will probably be created in the future.[/quote]Read the topic; 508+, which allows for future revisions. As for why, it’s for organization in both sections, and in the help section, to help people get questions answered sooner, because people will know what revision they are using. Also, the total time to add them would be about 15 minutes.

Read full topic

noobs are ftw:

servers that have packageing show the creator isnt lazy unlike most 317 servers nowadays

Besides, any person that correctly programs should begin with the basics. But, regarding half of this shit we call RSPS, most are just a simple WinterLove modified for the cache revision they work with.
